raw_text:
Goodrem wins top female MTV prize
 
 Pop singer Delta Goodrem has scooped one of the top individual prizes at the first Australian MTV Music Awards.
 
 The 21-year-old singer won the award for best female artist, with Australian Idol runner-up Shannon Noll taking the title of best male at the ceremony. Goodrem, known in both Britain and Australia for her role as Nina Tucker in TV soap Neighbours, also performed a duet with boyfriend Brian McFadden. Other winners included Green Day, voted best group, and the Black Eyed Peas. Goodrem, Green Day and the Black Eyed Peas took home two awards each. As well as best female, Goodrem also took home the Pepsi Viewers Choice Award, whilst Green Day bagged the prize for best rock video for American Idiot. The Black Eyed Peas won awards for best R 'n' B video and sexiest video, both for Hey Mama. Local singer and songwriter Missy Higgins took the title of breakthrough artist of the year, with Australian Idol winner Guy Sebastian taking the honours for best pop video. The VH1 First Music Award went to Cher honouring her achievements within the music industry. The ceremony was held at the Luna Park fairground in Sydney Harbour and was hosted by the Osbourne family. Artists including Carmen Electra, Missy Higgins, Kelly Osbourne, Green Day, Ja Rule and Natalie Imbruglia gave live performances at the event.
llama3.2:1b: Delta Goodrem won top female MTV prize for best female artist at the Australian MTV Music Awards. She also won Pepsi Viewers Choice Award as best female artist and took home two awards with Green Day and The Black Eyed Peas. Other winners included local artists Missy Higgins, Guy Sebastian, Kelly Osbourne, and various groups such as Cher and Green Day.
llama3.2:3b: Delta Goodrem won best female artist award at the Australian MTV Music Awards, alongside other winners Green Day, the Black Eyed Peas, and Missy Higgins. Other notable winners included Shannon Noll, Guy Sebastian, Cher, and duet performance by Goodrem and Brian McFadden.

Green Day won best rock video for "American Idiot", and the Black Eyed Peas won best R&B video and sexiest video for "Hey Mama". Missy Higgins was awarded breakthrough artist of the year, and Guy Sebastian won best pop video.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Goodrem won the MTV Australia Music Awards' top female prize for best female artist. She also won the Pepsi Viewers Choice Award and Black Eyed Peas Best Rock Video awards. Other winners included Australian Idol runner-up Shannon Noll, which she performed with brother Brian McFadden. The winner of the Local Music Category was Missy Higgins.

Goodrem also receives a Pepsi Viewers Choice Award and two music awards each with Green Day and the Black Eyed Peas.
qwen2.5:3b: Delta Goodrem wins best female artist at Australian MTV Music Awards, performed with Brian McFadden. Green Day and The Black Eyed Peas also take multiple awards. Missy Higgins wins breakthrough artist of the year, Guy Sebastian best pop video. VH1 First Music Award goes to Cher. Event hosted by Osbourne family at Luna Park fairground in Sydney Harbour.

Delta Goodrem won the top female MTV prize for best female artist at the 2019 Australian MTV Music Awards, taking home two awards: Best Female Artist (with Shannon Noll as Best Male) and the Pepsi Viewers Choice Award. Other winners included Green Day, Black Eyed Peas, Cher, Carmen Electra, Kelly Osbourne, Ja Rule, and Natalie Imbruglia.
tinyllama:1.1b: Leading Australian pop singer Delta Goodrem won the top individual prize in the first annual MTV Music Awards held at Sydney's Luca Park fairground on Saturday night (June 14). Goodrem, who turned 21 last month, performed a duet with her boyfriend Brian McFaulden. Other winners included Green Day, voted best group, and the Black Eyed Peas, while Australian Idol runner-up Shannon Noell took home the award for best female artist. The awards ceremony also saw several local singers and songwriters receive accolades, including Missy Higgiins who won the breakthrough artist of the year honor and American Idol winner Guy Sebastian receiving the title of best pop video. Cher gave a special performance at the event, which was hosted by Osbourne family members Kelly and Ozzy. Performances by Cher, Carmen Electra, Natalie Imbruglia, Missy Higgiins, Kelly Osbourne, Green Day, Ja Rule, and Australian Idol winner Shannon Noell also took place during the evening.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The MTV Australia Music Awards took place on June 10th at Sydney's Luna Park fairground, and it was a star-studded night for many talented performers. The winner of the best female artist award was Delta Goodrem, who has been making waves in both Australia and Britain with her role in Neighbours. Another top prize went to Green Day, who performed a duet with their former on-screen love interest Shannon Noll. The Black Eyed Peas won not one, but two awards - one for best rock video and the other for best R 'n' B video, both for Hey Mama. The winner of the breakthrough artist award was Missy Higgins, who has been quite a success herself in Australia with her chart-topping single, Hey Mama. Other notable winners included Guy Sebastian for best pop video and Australian Idol winner, Guy Sebastian. Cher received the VH1 First Music Award for honoring her achievements within the music industry, while Kelly Osbourne gave a heartfelt live performance at the event.
